revised_title: Calcium Regulation of Exocytosis and Endocytosis in Bovine Adrenal Medullary Cells
tldr: This article investigates the control of secretion in bovine adrenal medullary cells, focusing on the role of calcium in exocytosis and endocytosis. The authors develop a technique to make the plasma membrane permeable, allowing them to study the mechanisms of secretion. They find that catecholamine release has a specific requirement for Mg-ATP and is activated by micromolar concentrations of ionized calcium. The study provides insights into the control of exocytosis and endocytosis in secretory cells.
